Legal_Issue: Whether the Canadian Passport Order authorizes an Adjudicator to withhold passport services as a standalone sanction
Decision_Outcome: The decision to withhold passport services was set aside
Legal_Rule: The Canadian Passport Order does not explicitly empower Passport Canada to withhold passport services as a standalone sanction
Procedural_Issue: Adjudicator may have exceeded statutory authority
Grounds_for_Claim: Lack of statutory authorization for withholding passport services independently
Judicial_Review_Outcome: Decision set aside and remitted for redetermination
Key_Evidence_Considered: Misuse of the applicant's passport information
Applicant_Challenge: Adjudicator exceeded authority in imposing a standalone sanction
Court_Result: Federal Court ruled that the sanction was not authorized and remitted the case
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the Adjudicator's decision
Remedy_Sought: Set aside the decision and remit for redetermination
Resolution_Mechanism: Judicial review under administrative law principles
Applicable_Process: Administrative decision-making followed by judicial review
Outcome_of_Review: Decision invalidated due to lack of statutory authority
Governing_Rule: Statutory interpretation of the Canadian Passport Order
